description: The CodeBoarding system implements a pipeline-based "Code-to-Diagram" architecture that orchestrates deterministic static analysis with agentic AI interpretation. The workflow starts with environment preparation and project scanning, then runs two parallel tracks: a Static Analysis Engine that extracts structural code information (classes, calls, dependencies) and an AI Interpretation Layer where specialized agents synthesize semantic meanings and architectural abstractions. A Structural & Graph Analysis component clusters the raw code graph into logical units, while an Incremental State & Persistence layer tracks repository changes and caches results. Finally, an Output & Health Engine generates interactive diagrams, documentation, and diagnostic health reports.

components.name: Orchestration & Lifecycle Manager
components.description: The central brain and entry point; manages the end-to-end pipeline, environment setup (LSP installation), and parallel execution of analysis tracks.

components.name: Pipeline Orchestrator
components.description: Primary mediator that manages the overall execution flow, parallelizing static analysis and AI interpretation tracks, and coordinating other managers.

components.name: Pipeline Orchestrator
components.description: Central mediator managing execution flow, thread‑pooling for LLM calls, and lifecycle coordination of all agents.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Extracts deterministic ground‑truth structure, including CFGs, dependency graphs, and LOC metrics.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer
components.description: Composite of agents (MetaAgent, DetailsAgent) that provide semantic meaning and domain context to code structures.

components.name: Execution Planner
components.description: Deterministically manages the frontier queue, deciding which components require further expansion or re‑analysis.

components.name: Incremental State Manager
components.description: Manages repository state via hashing to determine if full re‑scans or delta‑based updates are required.

components.name: Health & Diagnostics Module
components.description: Executes structural checks (coupling, cohesion, circularity) to produce a health_report.json.

components.name: Abstraction Synthesizer
components.description: Transforms low‑level semantic insights into high‑level architectural summaries for documentation and diagrams.

components.name: Manifest Manager
components.description: Serializes the final analysis tree and metadata into persistent storage for the VS Code extension and CLI.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Extracts deterministic structural data (LOC, language detection, file statistics) from the codebase using deterministic tools.

components.name: Project Scanner
components.description: The primary orchestrator that manages the lifecycle of a scan, coordinating sub-extractors and aggregating results into a unified scan context.

components.name: File System Crawler
components.description: Efficiently traverses the directory tree, respects .gitignore rules, and identifies target source files for analysis.

components.name: Language Detector
components.description: Maps file extensions and content signatures to supported programming languages to route files to the correct analysis plugins.

components.name: Metrics Engine
components.description: Calculates deterministic statistics such as Lines of Code (LOC), cyclomatic complexity, and file counts.

components.name: CFG Extractor
components.description: Generates Control Flow Graphs (CFG) to map logical execution paths and function hierarchies within the source code.

components.name: LSP Orchestrator
components.description: Manages external Language Server Protocol (LSP) binaries to perform deep symbol resolution, "Go to Definition," and cross-referencing.

components.name: Symbol Indexer
components.description: Creates a searchable index of Qualified Names (QNames), definitions, and call sites across the entire codebase.

components.name: Metadata Repository
components.description: Persists extracted structural data and symbol mappings into DuckDB for consumption by the AI Interpretation Layer.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer

components.name: Abstraction Agent (Orchestrator)
components.description: The central controller of the interpretation pipeline. It manages the state and execution flow between semantic grouping and final architectural synthesis.

components.name: Semantic Cluster Grouper
components.description: Logic responsible for identifying logical relationships between deterministic CFG clusters. It uses LLMs to categorize code elements into functional modules.

components.name: Architectural Synthesis Engine
components.description: The final stage of the pipeline that transforms grouped clusters into high‑level documentation, narrative summaries, and architectural diagrams.

components.name: Multi-Provider LLM Gateway
components.description: A unified interface that abstracts interactions with various LLM backends (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, Ollama), allowing the agents to remain provider‑agnostic.

components.name: Context Preparation Module
components.description: Formats raw CFG data, metadata, and job state into structured prompts optimized for LLM consumption.

components.name: Incremental Manager
components.description: Compares repository states, manages delta logic, and skips analysis of unchanged files or components.

components.name: Environment Manager
components.description: Handles lifecycle of external binaries (LSP servers, Tokei) and ensures host platform compatibility.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: Manages Git operations, repository integrity checks, and state hashing for incremental analysis.

components.name: Plugin Registry
components.description: Provides a central lookup for dynamically loaded tools, agents, and health checks.

components.name: Registry Storage
components.description: A thread‑safe, typed container that maintains the lifecycle and state of all registered components, implementing Pythonic container protocols for runtime queries of agents, tools, and providers.

components.name: Registration Controller
components.description: The entry point for component injection; it validates metadata, enforces namespace rules, and registers new implementations, exposing a public decorator/function and handling duplicate registration errors.

components.name: Observability Suite
components.description: Tracks real‑time execution telemetry, including LLM latency, token usage, and pipeline traces.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine (Ground Truth)
components.description: Deterministic extraction of code structure using LSP clients and language-specific scanners; provides the raw data for all downstream components.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: The central pipeline driver that manages the analysis lifecycle. It coordinates project discovery, environment validation, and the parallel execution of language-specific LSP clients to aggregate a unified code model.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: The central pipeline driver that manages the analysis lifecycle. It coordinates project discovery, environment validation, and the parallel execution of language-specific LSP clients to aggregate a unified code model.

components.name: Environment Validator
components.description: Performs pre‑flight checks to ensure the execution environment is viable. It verifies the presence of required language‑specific LSP binaries and validates that the target project structure is compatible with the analysis engine.

components.name: LSP Client Manager
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of multiple Language Server Protocol (LSP) instances. It handles polyglot support by spawning, communicating with, and gracefully shutting down language servers for different programming languages.

components.name: Code Traversal Engine
components.description: Executes the recursive discovery of files and symbols within the project workspace. It utilizes the LSP communication channel to crawl the codebase and extract structural information.

components.name: Entity Transformer
components.description: Acts as the translation layer between raw LSP symbol data/CFG nodes and the standardized internal `Node` schema. It normalizes disparate language data into a uniform format.

components.name: Code Entity Schema
components.description: Defines the foundational domain model for the entire system. It contains the `Node` class and classification constants that represent the "ground truth" of the codebase.

components.name: Unified Model Aggregator
components.description: Merges disparate analysis results from various files and languages into a single, cohesive graph representation. It resolves cross‑references and builds the final structural model.

components.name: Job & Metadata Store
components.description: The persistence layer for the analysis process. It uses DuckDB to store analysis progress, job metadata, and intermediate results, allowing for incremental analysis and state recovery.

components.name: LSP Transport Engine
components.description: Implements the low-level JSON-RPC communication layer. It handles asynchronous message threading, request/response synchronization, and standard LSP method calls (symbols, definitions, call hierarchies).

components.name: LSP Client Orchestrator
components.description: Manages the lifecycle (start/stop/initialize) of the Language Server process and handles workspace-level configuration.

components.name: JSON-RPC Transport

components.name: Message Dispatcher
components.description: Routes incoming JSON‑RPC messages based on type: responses are sent to the Request Manager, while notifications go to the Diagnostics Handler.

components.name: Language Adapter Registry
components.description: A central hub that maps file extensions to LSP capabilities. It provides language-specific initialization parameters and bootstraps adapters (e.g., Java, TypeScript) to handle unique server behaviors.

components.name: LSP Client Base
components.description: The abstract foundation for all language-specific adapters. It encapsulates the core Language Server Protocol lifecycle, managing the underlying process communication and standard initialization sequences.

components.name: Java Language Provider
components.description: A specialized adapter for the Eclipse JDTLS. It handles complex Java-specific logic including JVM heap scaling, Maven/Gradle project synchronization, and processing JDTLS-specific status notifications.

components.name: TypeScript Language Provider
components.description: A specialized adapter for the TypeScript language server. It focuses on environment preparation, ensuring that Node.js dependencies (NPM/Yarn) are validated and the workspace is bootstrapped before server execution.

components.name: Language Metadata Registry
components.description: A central data store that maps language identifiers to their technical specifications, such as file extensions, suffix patterns, and the binary execution parameters required for their respective LSPs.

components.name: Language Specification Builder
components.description: A factory component responsible for the construction and validation of ProgrammingLanguage instances. It ensures that detected project metadata is correctly transformed into a valid configuration for the registry.

components.name: Java Configuration Model
components.description: A schema-driven component that provides structured access to Java-specific settings, such as JDTLS installation roots, runtime versions, and project-specific JVM arguments.

components.name: Language Adapter Registry
components.description: The primary entry point for the subsystem. It maps file extensions to specific LSP capabilities and bootstraps the appropriate provider (Java, TypeScript, etc.) based on the project context.

components.name: ProjectScanner
components.description: The primary orchestrator of the discovery phase. It performs an initial sweep of the repository using Tokei to generate language statistics and identifies potential project roots to trigger specialized scanners.

components.name: TypeScriptConfigScanner

components.name: ProgrammingLanguageBuilder

components.description: A centralized utility that implements filtering logic based on .gitignore files and internal exclusion patterns.

components.description: Extracts the raw Control Flow Graph (CFG) from static data, establishing the fundamental relationships (calls, dependencies) between code entities.

components.name: CallGraph Orchestrator

components.description: Bridges the deterministic‑semantic gap by converting internal graph structures into Mermaid.js or text for LLM consumption.

components.name: Graph Primitives

components.name: Adaptive Clustering Engine
components.description: Groups raw nodes into logical, hierarchical boundaries using Louvain-based community detection and applies balancing algorithms to prevent oversized clusters.

components.name: Incremental Impact Analyzer

components.name: Incremental Impact Analyzer
components.description: Central orchestrator that maps file-level diffs to architectural clusters to prune unnecessary analysis.

components.description: Limits the analysis set to a specific subset of files, such as those defined in a Pull Request or specific directory.

components.name: Action Determiner
components.description: Evaluates change severity to select an UpdateAction (e.g., PATCH_PATHS vs. FULL_REANALYSIS).

components.name: Cross-Boundary Checker
components.description: Uses the Control Flow Graph (CFG) to detect if local changes impact external architectural boundaries.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Provides the "ground truth" CallGraph used to verify if changes leak across component boundaries.

components.name: Incremental Updater
components.description: Executes the chosen UpdateAction, applying patches to the existing architectural model.

components.name: Structural Drift Analyzer
components.description: Quantifies architectural evolution by tracking node movement between clusters across versions and calculating stability metrics.

components.name: ClusterChangeAnalyzer
components.description: The primary orchestrator that executes the greedy Jaccard matching algorithm to pair clusters across versions, driving the identification, quantification, and reporting of structural changes.

components.name: ClusterMatch
components.description: A data model representing the mapping between an old cluster and its most similar new counterpart, including similarity scores and node movement details.

components.name: ChangeMetrics
components.description: Computational engine that calculates quantitative deltas such as node_movement_ratio and stability indices for matched clusters.

components.name: ClusterChangeResult
components.description: Aggregator DTO that packages all matches, calculated metrics, and final classification into a unified report for downstream consumption.

components.name: ChangeClassification
components.description: Policy‑driven Enum defining thresholds (Small, Medium, Big) to categorize the magnitude of architectural drift.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: The subsystem façade that coordinates multi-language analysis and manages the execution flow of the graph-to-cluster pipeline.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: The central façade that coordinates the multi‑language analysis flow and manages the execution of the graph‑to‑cluster pipeline. It acts as the primary entry point for the "Code‑to‑Diagram" process.

components.name: Incremental Manager
components.description: Tracks changes in the codebase to ensure only modified files or affected dependencies are re‑analyzed, optimizing performance for large repositories.

components.name: Language Scanner & LSP Bridge
components.description: Orchestrates language‑specific symbol extraction by interfacing with LSP servers and scanner configurations to generate the raw data for the CFG.

components.description: Constructs the deterministic Control Flow Graph (CFG) and maintains the structural "ground truth" of the application.

components.name: Adaptive Clustering Engine
components.description: Implements a strategy pattern to select community‑detection algorithms (Connectivity, Structural, etc.) based on graph density and codebase characteristics.

components.name: Cluster Result Aggregator

components.name: AI Abstraction Agent
components.description: Consumes aggregated cluster data to provide semantic meaning, high‑level documentation, and architectural summaries for identified code clusters.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: The central mediator (CodeBoardingAgent) that manages the end‑to‑end pipeline, LLM lifecycle, and agent coordination.

components.name: CodeBoardingAgent

components.name: Static Analysis Toolset
components.description: Deterministic tools that extract ground‑truth data such as CFG, packages, and method definitions.

components.name: Context Provider

components.name: File Classifier
components.description: Semantically groups files using LLMs for items that escape deterministic static rules.

components.name: Density Evaluator
components.description: Performs deterministic calculations on CFG and LSP metadata to identify "hotspots"—files or modules with high fan‑in/fan‑out or complexity that require prioritized analysis.

components.name: Strategy Generator
components.description: Translates raw density metrics and LLM reasoning into a structured sequence of actionable tasks for downstream abstraction agents.

components.name: Context Aggregator
components.description: Filters and packages global repository metadata, such as file trees and symbol tables, into a compressed format suitable for LLM context windows.

components.name: Job State Manager

components.description: Pre‑computes reachability matrices between code clusters to enable high‑performance graph validation.

components.name: Validation Result Generator

components.name: Static Analysis Bridge

components.name: Semantic Data Models
components.description: Defines the Pydantic‑based schemas (AnalysisInsights, Component) for structured inter‑agent communication.

components.name: Insight Serialization Hub
components.description: Acts as the central formatting engine for the subsystem. It defines high‑level insight containers and the primary serialization logic (`llm_str`) used to present complex code structures to LLMs.

components.name: LLM Schema Foundation
components.description: Provides the base Pydantic models and extraction utilities. It ensures that any data model used in the AI pipeline can be reliably parsed from raw LLM JSON responses.

components.name: Architectural Domain Models
components.description: Defines the core structural entities of a software system—Components and Relations. These represent the "nodes and edges" of the analyzed codebase.

components.name: Source Grounding Provider
components.description: Maps abstract semantic insights back to physical source code. It ensures that every AI‑generated component or insight is "grounded" in a specific file and line range.

components.name: Deterministic Identity Manager
components.description: A utility layer that generates stable, hash‑based identifiers for components. This allows the system to track the same component across multiple incremental analysis runs.

components.name: Agent Tooling & Repository Context
components.description: The "hands" of the AI agents; provides specialized tools to read files, inspect CFGs, and detect Git diffs to focus analysis on relevant code areas.

components.name: Agent Tooling Orchestrator
components.description: The primary entry point for agents; aggregates all specialized tools and manages their lifecycle.

components.name: Toolkit Orchestrator
components.description: Primary entry point (CodeBoardingToolkit) that manages the lifecycle and aggregation of all specialized tools for agents, delegating requests to the appropriate providers.

components.name: Tool Discovery Registry
components.description: Filters and provides toolsets (via get_agent_tools) based on agent roles, ensuring each agent receives only the tools relevant to its specialization.

components.name: Structural Analysis Provider
components.description: Supplies deterministic hierarchical data such as package structures and class hierarchies by interfacing with the core static analysis engine.

components.name: Behavioral Analysis Provider
components.description: Delivers flow‑centric data, specifically control flow graphs (CFGs) and method invocation chains, translating them into agent‑readable formats.

components.name: Source & Metadata Accessor
components.description: Handles retrieval of raw source code, documentation, and file‑level metadata, providing the final reference content for the AI layer.

components.name: Dependency Resolver
components.description: Identifies and provides context for external third‑party dependencies and their relationships to the codebase.

components.name: Repository Context Manager
components.description: Maintains the shared state of the repository, including root paths, ignore rules, and metadata.

components.name: Structural Analysis Engine
components.description: Extracts high-level organization, including file trees, package hierarchies, and class structures.

components.name: File System Explorer
components.description: Traverses the repository to build a hierarchical directory tree, filtering ignored paths.

components.name: Package Hierarchy Analyzer
components.description: Maps internal module relationships and package dependencies to build a logical graph.

components.name: Code Definition Extractor
components.description: Parses Python source files to extract class hierarchies, function signatures, and decorators.

components.name: External Dependency Scanner
components.description: Identifies third‑party libraries and external requirements via imports and metadata.

components.name: Structural Cache Manager
components.description: Manages the cached_dirs state to prevent redundant I/O during multi‑pass analysis.

components.name: Behavioral Analysis Engine
components.description: Models execution logic by generating Control Flow Graphs (CFG) and method invocation chains.

components.name: CFG Analyzer
components.description: Extracts intra‑procedural logic to identify execution paths, loops, and conditional branches within a single method.

components.name: Invocation Analyzer
components.description: Scans the codebase to map inter‑procedural dependencies, identifying where and how methods are called across different modules.

components.name: Behavioral Model Synthesizer
components.description: Aggregates CFG data and invocation chains into a unified model representing the behavioral ground truth of a feature.

components.name: LSP Integration Bridge
components.description: Interfaces with Language Server Protocol binaries to resolve symbol definitions and references required for accurate flow mapping.

components.name: Flow Visualization Provider
components.description: Converts raw CFG and invocation data into Mermaid.js or JSON formats for visual representation in the final documentation.

components.name: Change Tracking Manager
components.description: Interfaces with Git to detect diffs and map changes to specific code entities for incremental analysis.

components.name: Git CLI Wrapper
components.description: Executes low-level Git commands and parses raw stdout into primitive objects. It serves as the subsystem's hardware abstraction layer for the version control system.

components.name: Repository State Analyzer
components.description: Validates repository integrity and retrieves environmental context such as HEAD hashes and workspace status to ensure analysis consistency.

components.name: Incremental Change Classifier
components.description: The logic engine that categorizes raw file changes into logical types (Added, Deleted, Modified, Renamed) to determine the scope of incremental processing.

components.name: Change Manifest
components.description: A structured data model (ChangeSet) that encapsulates the delta. It provides query methods to help the Orchestration Engine decide which files require full re-analysis versus metadata updates.

components.name: Semantic Diff Provider
components.description: Acts as the bridge to the AI Interpretation Layer. It translates technical diff data into a structured llm_str optimized for Agentic consumption.

components.name: StaticAnalysisResults

components.name: CodeReferenceReader

components.name: ReadFileTool

components.name: ReadDocsTool

components.name: Tool Base Framework
components.description: The foundational layer providing standardized inheritance and shared utilities for all repository tools.

components.name: BaseRepoTool
components.description: Abstract base class defining the standard interface, inheritance patterns, and shared utilities for all repository‑aware tools.

components.name: RepoContext

components.name: CodeBoardingToolkit
components.description: Orchestration component responsible for the lifecycle of tools and injecting the shared RepoContext into tool instances.

components.name: StaticAnalysisResults

components.name: FileSystemDiscovery

components.name: RepoIgnoreManager
components.description: Filtering utility that applies exclusion logic (e.g., .gitignore patterns) to ensure tools only operate on relevant code.

components.name: SpecializedAnalysisTools

components.name: Incremental State & Persistence
components.description: Manages system memory and performance; handles serialization of analysis results and maintains a MetaCache to avoid redundant LLM calls.

components.name: Incremental Orchestrator
components.description: Central mediator that coordinates the incremental update flow, deciding between deterministic patches and full re‑expansions based on impact analysis.

components.name: Incremental Orchestrator
components.description: Workflow controller that drives the incremental update pipeline; it invokes the Component Mapper, Impact Analyzer and Execution Engine in sequence.

components.name: Component Mapper
components.description: Discovers file‑level modifications and translates them into internal architectural qualified names, producing the “dirty list”.

components.name: Impact Analyzer
components.description: Evaluates the dirty components and decides, for each, whether a low‑cost deterministic patch or a high‑cost AI re‑expansion is needed; populates the Change Impact Model.

components.name: Scoped Analyzer
components.description: Restricts the dependency search space to a bounded sub‑graph so that the Impact Analyzer only inspects relevant upstream/downstream components.

components.name: Execution Engine
components.description: Consumes the Change Impact Model and applies the concrete updates (e.g., persisting to DuckDB, regenerating Mermaid snippets).

components.name: Change Impact Model
components.description: Typed data contract that carries the summary of changes (patch vs. re‑expansion) from the analysis phase to the execution phase.

components_relations.relation: passes dirty component list for assessment

components.name: State & Metadata Store
components.description: Manages file fingerprints, LLM prompt hashes (MetaCache), and job statuses in DuckDB to avoid redundant work.

components.name: MetaCache Engine
components.description: The central coordinator that manages the lifecycle of the DuckDB connection and provides the primary API for state persistence. It acts as a Facade for all metadata operations.

components.name: DuckDB Persistence Provider
components.description: Handles low‑level SQL execution, connection pooling, and the physical storage of metadata on disk.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Tracker
components.description: Manages file fingerprints (hashes) to determine which source files have changed since the last analysis run, enabling incremental analysis.

components.name: Semantic Prompt Cache
components.description: Stores hashes of LLM prompts and their corresponding AI responses to avoid redundant API calls and minimise token spend.

components.name: Job Status Registry
components.description: Tracks the execution state of various pipeline stages, allowing the orchestration engine to resume interrupted jobs.

components.name: Schema Manager
components.description: Defines and maintains the DuckDB table structures for fingerprints, prompt hashes, and job metadata, ensuring data integrity across versions.

components.name: Impact Analyzer
components.description: Evaluates filesystem changes to identify "dirty" components and determines if changes are structural or documentation‑only.

components.name: ChangeDetector
components.description: Monitors the filesystem or Git history to identify modified, added, or deleted files since the last successful analysis.

components.name: DiffParser
components.description: Performs low‑level parsing of file differences to isolate specific code hunks and line‑level changes.

components.name: StructuralComparator
components.description: Compares AST (Abstract Syntax Tree) or CFG snapshots to determine if a change affects logic/structure or is purely cosmetic.

components.name: ImpactClassifier
components.description: Categorizes changes into types (e.g., STRUCTURAL, DOC_ONLY, METADATA_ONLY) to inform the orchestration strategy.

components.name: DependencyGraphTracker
components.description: Maps relationships between files and symbols to identify downstream "dirty" components affected by an upstream change.

components.name: MetadataRegistry
components.description: Interfaces with DuckDB to retrieve the "last known good" state of the repository for comparison.

components.name: DirtyStateManager
components.description: Maintains the persistent list of components requiring re‑validation and tracks their progress through the pipeline.

components.name: ImpactOrchestrator
components.description: The central coordinator that executes the impact analysis workflow and returns the final "dirty" set to the main engine.

components.name: Persistence & Artifact Manager
components.description: Handles hierarchical storage and retrieval of analysis results, call graphs, and serialized class hierarchies.

components.name: Analysis Lifecycle Orchestrator
components.description: The central coordinator for analysis artifacts. It manages the state of persisted results and provides the primary API for saving and loading the system's "last known good" state.

components.name: Atomic Persistence Engine
components.description: A low-level utility component that guarantees data integrity. It implements thread‑safe, locked write operations to prevent file corruption during concurrent analysis tasks.

components.name: Incremental Change Processor
components.description: Optimizes the analysis pipeline by classifying file changes (new, modified, deleted). It maps these changes to existing component clusters to determine which parts of the graph require re‑analysis.

components.name: Hierarchical Data Accessor
components.description: Provides an abstraction for loading analysis data at different granularities. It allows the system to fetch either the full root‑level graph or specific sub‑analysis fragments on demand.

components.name: Diagram Metadata Engine
components.description: Transforms raw, low‑level analysis data into topological metadata. This metadata is specifically structured to drive interactive Mermaid.js visualizations and "expandable" component views.

components.name: Persistence Factory
components.description: A singleton‑pattern provider that ensures all modules (CLI, VS Code, Agents) interact with a consistent, unified instance of the analysis store.

components_relations.relation: Instantiates and manages the lifecycle of the singleton store instance.
Delegates all serialization and disk‑writing tasks to ensure thread‑safe operations.

Notifies the store of detected changes to trigger state updates.

components.name: File & Component Mapper
components.description: Maps physical source files to logical architectural components, maintaining the bridge between code and model.

components.name: Structural Patcher
components.description: Executes deterministic updates to the analysis manifest, such as path renames and entity reference updates.

components.name: IncrementalUpdater
components.description: The primary orchestrator that manages the lifecycle of an update from detection to manifest commit.

components.name: ImpactAnalyzer
components.description: Evaluates ChangeSets against the manifest to determine the UpdateAction (Patch, Update, or Full).

components.name: PathPatching
components.description: Executes deterministic updates to file paths and entity references within the manifest and insights.

components.name: FileManager
components.description: Handles the physical addition/removal of files and synchronizes their mappings in the manifest.

components.name: ComponentChecker
components.description: Validation logic that determines if a component's internal structure is stable enough for a patch.

components.name: ReexpansionEngine
components.description: Triggers the AI DetailsAgent to re‑analyze components that have undergone significant structural changes.

components.name: ScopedAnalysis
components.description: Restricts static analysis and AI interpretation to only the "dirty" or affected parts of the codebase.

components.name: AnalysisManifest
components.description: The persistent state‑tracking entity containing the mapping of files to components and the base commit.

components.name: Component Re-expander
components.description: Orchestrates AI agents to perform semantic re‑analysis when structural changes exceed simple patch thresholds.

components.name: Re-expansion Orchestrator
components.description: Central controller that manages the lifecycle of a re‑expansion job, coordinating detection, analysis, and persistence phases.

components.name: Change Threshold Monitor
components.description: Evaluates structural drift between the current CFG and the last indexed state to decide if a simple patch is insufficient.

components.name: Context Assembler
components.description: Aggregates deterministic ground‑truth data (CFG, LSP symbols) and historical metadata to build a comprehensive prompt for AI agents.

components.name: Semantic Re-analyzer
components.description: LLM‑powered agent that interprets the intent behind structural changes, moving beyond raw code to high‑level functional meaning.

components.name: Abstraction Refiner
components.description: Ensures the AI's semantic output aligns with project‑specific documentation standards, applying granularity filters and formatting to Mermaid syntax.

components.name: State Synchronizer
components.description: Reconciles the newly generated semantic model with persistent storage (DuckDB), updating the world view.

components.name: Integrity Validator
components.description: Ensures the consistency of the call graph and component relationships after any incremental update or patch.

components.name: Incremental Orchestrator
components.description: Primary coordinator of the update pipeline, managing transition between change detection, deterministic patching, and semantic re‑analysis.

components.name: Impact Analyzer
components.description: Analyzes the blast radius of file changes to identify which components are dirty and require updated abstractions.

components.name: Path Patcher
components.description: Executes deterministic updates for file renames and moves, keeping the manifest synchronized without triggering AI re‑analysis.

components.name: State Manager
components.description: Persistent source of truth managing the manifest and DuckDB metadata that tracks component relationships.

components.name: Scoped AI Analyzer
components.description: Triggers targeted LLM agents to re‑abstract components identified as semantically changed by the Impact Analyzer.

components.name: Component Manager
components.description: Verifies health and existence of components on the file system, synchronizing the physical state with the logical manifest.

components.name: Integrity Validator
components.description: Final quality gate that audits the updated call graph and component relationships for logical consistency.

components.name: Output & Health Engine
components.description: Decouples analysis from presentation; generates Mermaid/Markdown documentation and runs diagnostic checks (circular deps, unused code) for health reporting.

components.name: Health Analysis Runner
components.description: The central orchestrator for the health subsystem. It manages the execution lifecycle of various diagnostics, aggregates results into a comprehensive report, and applies configuration-based filtering.

components.name: Health Analysis Runner
components.description: The central orchestrator that manages the execution lifecycle of diagnostics and applies configuration‑based filtering.

components.name: Static Health Evaluator
components.description: Performs the actual deterministic analysis of repository structure to compute health scores and "ground truth" metrics.

components.name: Health Result Aggregator
components.description: Consolidates individual diagnostic outputs and scores into a comprehensive, unified health report.

components.name: Workspace Manager
components.description: Provides path normalization and filesystem isolation to ensure health checks are executed against a stable environment.

components.name: CLI Orchestrator
components.description: The local entry point that triggers the Health Analysis Runner during manual developer executions.

components.name: Action Orchestrator
components.description: The CI/CD entry point that invokes health checks to gate documentation deployment in GitHub Actions.

components.name: Git Provider
components.description: Supplies repository state, branch info, and state hashing to the runner for incremental health analysis.

components.name: Multi-Format Doc Engine
components.description: Transforms the aggregated health reports into human‑readable formats like Markdown or HTML for the final output.

components.name: Static Diagnostic Engine
components.description: A suite of specialized modules that perform mathematical and structural analysis on the codebase to identify technical debt and architectural erosion.

components.name: Health Orchestrator
components.description: Central mediator that ingests CFG/Hierarchy data, parses it into localized contexts and dispatches structured metadata to the specialized diagnostic modules. It also aggregates the results from the checks into a final health report.

components.name: Complexity Analyzer
components.description: Evaluates code volume and method density to identify "God Classes" and oversized functions, producing volume‑based risk scores.

components.name: Coupling Evaluator
components.description: Measures afferent (Ca) and efferent (Ce) coupling to determine package‑level dependencies.

components.name: Instability Calculator
components.description: Computes the Instability index I = Ce / (Ca + Ce) from the raw coupling data, indicating how easily a component can be changed.

components.name: Cohesion Checker
components.description: Analyzes internal class connectivity (e.g., LCOM) to detect fragmented classes and feature‑envy.

components.name: Inheritance Profiler
components.description: Measures the Depth of Inheritance Tree (DIT) to identify overly deep or complex hierarchies.

components.name: Dependency Cycle Detector
components.description: Performs graph‑based analysis to find strongly connected components and circular package dependencies that break modularity.

components.name: LSP Integration Service
components.description: Bridges the gap between static structure and semantic meaning by interfacing with Language Server Protocol (LSP) binaries to extract deep diagnostics like dead code and unused imports.

components.name: LSP Binary Orchestrator
components.description: Manages the lifecycle, configuration, and JSON-RPC communication for various language server binaries (e.g., pyright, rust-analyzer).

components.name: LSP Diagnostics Collector
components.description: Triggers workspace-wide scans and captures raw diagnostic events and FileDiagnostic objects from the active LSP sessions.

components.name: Diagnostic Mapper
components.description: Normalizes heterogeneous LSP messages into internal DiagnosticIssue models, mapping external severity levels to system-wide constants.

components.name: Diagnostic Processor
components.description: Aggregates and filters normalized issues to identify high-level patterns like dead code clusters or unused import chains.

components.name: Subsystem Health Provider
components.description: Acts as the public interface, exposing processed health data to the Orchestration Engine and AI Interpretation Layer.

components_relations.relation: provides active JSON-RPC transport channels and signals server readiness
sends raw diagnostic payloads for transformation into internal domain categories
streams normalized DiagnosticIssue objects for batch processing
supplies aggregated health summaries and filtered actionable issues

components.name: Health Schema & Models
components.description: Defines the standardized Pydantic-based data structures used across the health subsystem to ensure consistent reporting of findings and severity levels.

components.name: Health Model Registry
components.description: Defines the Pydantic schemas (`HealthFinding` and `HealthReport`) that validate and serialize all diagnostic data.

components.name: Severity Classification System
components.description: Provides the `Severity` enumeration (Critical, Warning, etc.) used to rank the impact of each finding.

components.name: Structural Integrity Evaluator
components.description: Executes deterministic checks (e.g., circular dependencies) and creates `HealthFinding` instances based on the schema.

components.name: Health Scoring Engine
components.description: Consumes a `HealthReport`'s collection of findings to compute a numeric health score (0‑100).

components.name: Diagnostic Result Aggregator
components.description: Collects individual `HealthFinding` objects into a unified `HealthReport` or `StandardCheckSummary`.

components.name: Standardized Summary Interface
components.description: Defines the `StandardCheckSummary` DTO that external consumers (VS Code, Mermaid.js) use to display health information.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Registry
components.description: Tracks the state of the repository across runs. It maintains a manifest of analyzed files and coverage data to enable delta-based updates rather than full re-analysis.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: The primary mediator of the "Code-to-Diagram" pipeline. It coordinates the flow between deterministic static analysis and semantic AI interpretation, managing the lifecycle of analysis tasks.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer
components.description: A multi‑agent system that performs semantic abstraction. It uses LLMs to transform raw code structures into high‑level "AnalysisInsights" and fine‑grained component relationships.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Provides the "ground truth" for the system. It extracts deterministic structural data, such as Control Flow Graphs (CFGs) and symbol tables, which serve as the foundation for AI analysis.

components.name: Incremental Updater
components.description: The logic engine responsible for delta‑based analysis. It compares current filesystem hashes against the stored manifest to identify "dirty" files that require re‑processing.

components.name: Manifest Registry
components.description: The persistent state store for the repository. It maintains a mapping of file hashes to analyzed components and tracks the overall repository version across runs.

components.name: Project Scanner
components.description: Discovers source files within the repository and extracts essential metadata (LOC, language, and initial hashes) required for both coverage calculation and incremental checks.

components.name: File Coverage Calculator
components.description: Produces repository‑wide metrics by computing the delta between the total project scope (from the Scanner) and successfully analyzed files (from the Manifest).

components.name: Unified Analysis Engine
components.description: Acts as the "Data Normalizer" for the entire project. It converts disparate data from the Static Analysis Engine and Health Runner into a single UnifiedAnalysisJson format.

components.name: Unified Analysis Aggregator
components.description: Primary entry point that orchestrates assembly of metadata, file coverage, and component hierarchies into the final UnifiedAnalysisJson.

components.name: JSON Schema Registry
components.description: Defines core data contracts (ComponentJson, RelationJson) that ensure interoperability across the headless core.

components.name: Structural Transformer
components.description: Performs recursive tree operations, including deterministic ID assignment and re‑keying of components to ensure stable references.

components.name: Hierarchy Calculator
components.description: Computes structural metrics such as depth levels and nesting indices required for hierarchical visualizations.

components.name: Model Adapter
components.description: Provides low‑level conversion logic to transform internal Python analysis models into JSON‑serializable objects.

components.name: Analysis Parser
components.description: Handles deserialization of existing unified analysis files back into memory for incremental updates or comparisons.

requests depth and nesting calculations to enrich the component metadata
uses the schema definitions to validate the integrity of the tree after re‑keying or ID assignment

components.name: Documentation & Diagram Generator
components.description: The presentation layer that consumes the unified schema to produce human-readable artifacts, primarily Mermaid.js diagrams and Markdown documentation.

components.name: Artifact Orchestrator
components.description: Primary mediator that manages the generation lifecycle, selecting the appropriate generator based on user configuration.

components.name: MDX Generator
components.description: Orchestrates the creation of MDX files, integrating React‑like components and assembling complex content blocks.

components.name: Frontmatter Manager
components.description: Constructs YAML metadata (titles, IDs, sidebars) required by modern doc portals like Docusaurus or Nextra.

components.name: Sphinx Generator
components.description: Produces reStructuredText (RST) files, handling Sphinx‑specific syntax like title underlining and RST directives.

components.name: Markdown Generator
components.description: Creates standard GitHub‑flavored Markdown, focusing on portability and simple code‑block integration.

components.name: Mermaid Syntax Engine
components.description: Translates the Unified Schema/CFG into Mermaid.js DSL (Flowcharts, Class Diagrams, Sequence Diagrams).

components.name: Template Registry
components.description: Manages the layout templates used by generators to ensure consistent styling across different output formats.

components.name: Interactive Visualization UI
components.description: Manages the frontend assets and template injection required to create browser-based, interactive system maps using Cytoscape.js.

components.name: HTML Generation Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the primary mediator; coordinates data mapping, script generation, and template assembly.

components.name: Cytoscape Data Mapper
components.description: Transforms semantic AnalysisInsights into the specific JSON schema (nodes/edges) required by Cytoscape.js.

components.name: HTML Template Manager
components.description: Manages the base HTML structure, CSS boilerplate, and placeholders for dynamic content injection.

components.name: JavaScript Script Engine
components.description: Synthesizes the final <script> block by aggregating style, layout, and interaction logic.

components.name: Visual Style Provider
components.description: Defines the visual mapping (colors, shapes, sizes) for different node types and relationship strengths.

components.name: Layout Configurator
components.description: Configures the physics and positioning algorithms (e.g., COSE, Dagre) for the graph visualization.

components.name: Interaction Handler
components.description: Generates client‑side JavaScript for user actions like clicking, hovering, and zooming.
